column2: WYOMING DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 2. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: You must bear either right or left

column2: 4. Which shape is a stop sign?
5. This road sign means:
6. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 7. Two solid yellow lines between lanes of traffic means:
column6: passing is permitted on the left.
column8: the lanes are designed to carry traffic in one direction at certain times and in the opposite direction at other times.

column2: 8. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 9. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 10. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column6: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column8: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

column2: 11. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.
column6: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column8: you may not cross the broken white line.

column2: 12. Before entering a curve, you should:
13. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column8: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 14. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 15. BAC is expressed in:
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 16. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column6: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 17. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 18. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 19. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.

column2: 20. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 21. A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
column8: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 22. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 25. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 26. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.

column2: 27. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
28. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
30. When passing another vehicle, you should return to your lane if:
column4: you have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
column6: you are at least 25 feet in front of the passed vehicle.
column8: you can see both headlights in the rearview mirror.

column2: 31. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: if you wait until the light changes.
column6: after making a complete stop first.
column8: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column8: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 33. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 34. Yellow traffic signs:
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 35. Which shape is a warning sign?
36. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
37. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 38. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Stop and wait for the green light
column8: Stop and yield the right of way.

column2: 39. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
40. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
41. When parking downhill:
column4: turn your wheels away from the side of the road.
column6: turn your wheels towards the side of the road.

column2: 42. If a pedestrian is illegal crossing in the middle of the street (not at a crosswalk) you:
column4: do not have to stop for them.
column6: should increase your speed, honk your horn and proceed.

column2: 43. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column8: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 44. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
45. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.

column2: 46. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
47. You should increase your following distance:
column6: at night or if it is raining.

column2: 48. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
49. Alcohol:
column6: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 50. This road sign means:
column6: Right turn on red light permitted
